result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy D. Medley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy D. Medley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy D. Medley was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Citgo Station 3900 52nd St.  Court wants agent to submit reports to the Court on 60 day intervals on his probation supervision.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION court imposes 100 days jail, commencing forthwith.  No huber allowed.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Bielski.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3 years.  See conditions.  DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  No restitution.  Bond to apply to financial obligations.  Balance may be returned to poster.
from doc

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Don Bielski.  Court did not receive PSI.  Sentencing set over to 1/10/17 @ 1:30pm.  NOTE - Clerk Lehman contact Agent Nolan; she will forward the PSI to the court via email.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Don Bielski.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 11/14/16 @ 2pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Don Bielski.  Case not resolved; defense counsel requests another adjournment - deft missed his office appt.  Deft admonished about missing his office appointment(s) in the future.  Another FPT set for 9/15/16 @ 1pm.  JS to remain on for 9/26/16

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Another FPT set for 9/6/16 at 9:30.  Case to remain on for jury selection on 9/26/16 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
Scheduling Order

Defendant, Timothy D. Medley, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  PTC 08-19-16 at 10am ;  JS 09-26-16 at 9am.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared (late) in person w/Atty Don Bielski.  Deft admonished by the Court about his tardiness.  Case is remanded back to Intake Court for a prelim hrg on 7/26/16 @ 8:15am.  Dates given for FPT/JS here in branch 3 along w/co-deft case.  FPT 8/19/16 @ 10am, JS 9/26/16 @ 9am.
FPT moved from 7/7 to 7/8/16 @ 10:45am due to court's unavailability; email sent to attys
Final pre-trial on July 8, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Donald Bielski.  Defense counse reports the decision has been received upholding the court's decision; case will remain in adult court.  Defense will not be appealing the decision.  FPT set for 7/7/16 @ 10:45am, JS 7/25/16 @ 9am along w/co-deft case.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Don Bielski.  To date, no decision from COA.  Another status set for 5/6/16 @ 9:30am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Andrea Rufo appeared on behalf of deft Kiara Murray (not transported from the KCJ).  Deft Medley appeared (10min late) w/Atty Donald Bielski.  Deft Medley was waived from JV court; defense counsel in JV court filed an appeal - briefs are due in February.  Atty Rufo's case is in limbo - her client filed a subst. of Judge Schroeder but was denied by the Court Comm since deft Medley is a co-deft.  Brief discussion held.  Any decision on subst. request will have to be delayed until April.  Per Court, set cases for status in April.  Status set for 4/11/16 @ 2pm.
due to ongoing jury trial - status conf moved from 9:30am to 10:30am; attys notified via email

Defendant, Timothy D. Medley, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  An appeal has been filed in the underlying juvenile case.  Judge Schroeder has previously indicated a stipulation or hearing to stay proceedings.  Court tolls time limits and sets case for status hearing with Br 3.  Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.
